The claim was debunked by the expert: s verdict, stating that the website Real News Right Now published a satirical article about President Trump ordering the execution of turkeys pardoned by President Obama.
The expert: s verdict highlighted indicators from the Real News Right Now website, such as the absence of a disclaimer and humorous claims on their "About" page, indicating that the article was satirical in nature.
The White House Press Secretary: Sean Spicer, was quoted in the expert's verdict, stating that President Trump determined that the turkey pardons issued by Obama were deceitful and hazardous, leading to the decision to destroy the surviving turkeys.
